text: Joel Grey (born Joel David Katz; April 11, 1932) is an American actor, singer, dancer, and photographer. ==Early life== Gray was born in Cleveland, Ohio to Goldie Epstein and to Mickey Katz. He studied at the Cleveland Play House and at Alexander Hamilton High School in Los Angeles, California. ==Career== Grey played the role of the Master of Ceremonies in the Broadway musical Cabaret in 1966 for which he won the Tony Award. Grey won an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor in March 1973 for his performance in the same role in the 1972 film version of Cabaret.Internet Movie Database listing, Awards imdb.com, retrieved December 21, 2009 He also won the Golden Globe Award. Grey had many other successful performances as an actor. Gray is also a published photographer, with books Pictures I Had to Take 2003; its follow-up, Looking Hard at Unexpected Things 2006.Joel Grey Looking Hard at Unexamined Things.
